intro: Argemone subfusiformis subsp. subinermis, commonly known as the narrowleaf argemone, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America and the southern United States. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
